article_title: Shuster, Halvorson share differing views at candidate forum

og.description: In less than 10 days, Republican voters in the 9th Congressional District will go to the polls to likely nominate their next representative in Washington, D.C.With no Democrats on the ballot, the GOP electorate in the district that stretches from Fayette County through Indiana, Bedford, Blair, Fulton and Franklin counties and includes portions of Greene, Washington, Wesmoreland, Cambria, Huntingdon and Somerset counties, will choose between incumbent U.S. Rep. Bill Shuster of Hollidaysburg, and retired U.S. Coast Guard Capt. Art Halvorson of Manns Choice in the April 26 primary race.
